articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website

articles.title: Analysis
articles.description: An analysis of the traffic infraction records
articles.contents:
Introduction
When drivers break the regulations that govern vehicle operation on
streets and highways, they commit a traffic violation. These kind of
infractions are extremely widespread. Local police frequently issue
traffic infractions, which are then handled by local sections of state
courts. Is there, however, a certain racial or age group to whom the
police give these offences more frequently? Is there any prejudice in
who gets the violations? This studyâ€™s analysis will provide answers to
all of these queries.
Graphical Analysis
Differen Types of Violations
There are several forms of offences that might result in a police
stop. Speeding, moving violations (Reckless Driving, Hit and Run,
Assaulting another driver, pedestrian, improper turns and lane changes),
Equipment (Window tint violations, Headlight/taillights out, Loud
exhaust, Cracked windshield), Registration/Plates, and Seat Belt, are
the most common types of violations. The following is a graph
visualizing the most common types of violations.

articles.title: Traffic Violations
articles.description: What a driver should avoid on the road; an examination of traffic infraction records.
articles.contents:
Context
As a new driver about to acquire my licence, I consider avoiding
traffic and road violations to be my top concern. However, certain
mistakes and accidents on the road are inevitable, leading to these
offences that may result in a police stop. As a result, this research
involves an analysis of these violations to determine who and why they
are frequently stopped.
